verse: The boy Samuel was serving Yahweh under Eli. In those days a prophecy from Yahweh was rare; visions were infrequent.
One night Eli was lying down in his room. His eyesight had begun to fail so that he couldn’t see well.
The lamp in Elohim’s temple hadn’t gone out yet, and Samuel was asleep in the temple of Yahweh where the ark of Elohim was kept.
Then Yahweh called Samuel. “Here I am,” Samuel responded.
He ran to Eli and said, “Here I am. You called me.”
Yahweh called Samuel again. Samuel got up, went to Eli, and said, “Here I am. You called me.”
Samuel had no experience with Yahweh, because the word of Yahweh had not yet been revealed to him.
Yahweh called Samuel a third time. Samuel got up, went to Eli, and said, “Here I am. You called me.”
“Go, lie down,” Eli told Samuel. “When he calls you, say, ‘Speak, Yahweh. I’m listening.’” So Samuel went and lay down in his room.
Yahweh came and stood there. He called as he had called the other times: “Samuel! Samuel!” And Samuel replied, “Speak. I’m listening.”
Then Yahweh said to Samuel, “I am going to do something in Israel that will make the ears of everyone who hears it ring.
On that day I am going to do to Eli and his family everything I said from beginning to end.
I told him that I would hand down a permanent judgment against his household because he knew about his sons’ sin—that they were cursing God—but he didn’t try to stop them.
That is why I have taken an oath concerning Eli’s family line: No offering or sacrifice will ever be able to make peace for the sins that Eli’s family committed.”
Samuel remained in bed until morning. Then he opened the doors of Yahweh’s house. But Samuel was afraid to tell Eli about the vision.
Then Eli called Samuel. “Samuel, my son!” he said.
“What did Yahweh tell you?” he asked. “Please don’t hide anything from me. May Elohim strike you dead if you hide anything he told you from me.”
So Samuel told Eli everything.
Samuel grew up. Yahweh was with him and didn’t let any of his words go unfulfilled.
All Israel from Dan to Beersheba knew Samuel was Yahweh’s appointed prophet.
Yahweh continued to appear in Shiloh, since Yahweh revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh through the word of Yahweh. And Samuel spoke to all Israel.
